intro: Justicia lucida, commonly known as the silverleaf jewelweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its rapid growth habit makes it both a valuable ornamental plant and a potential weed in certain habitats.
